div.p: NARRATOR: Now, we're going to look at what research shows about the effect of having a birth parent with alcoholism.
NARRATOR: These symbols represent large numbers of birth parents who decide to place their babies for adoption.
NARRATOR: This one represents those birth parents who do not have alcoholism. This one represents all the birth parents who do have alcoholism.
NARRATOR: These two symbols represent large numbers of adoptive parents. None of these adoptive parents have alcoholism.
NARRATOR: Ready? Now, these two symbols represent large numbers of the children adopted by these parents.
NARRATOR: This one represents those adopted children whose birth parents do not have alcoholism and whose adoptive parents also do not have alcoholism.
NARRATOR: And this one represents those adopted children who have a birth parent with alcoholism, but whose adoptive parents do not have alcoholism.
